programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: Charles Webster, a man with a passion for technical engineering challenges, along with his wife Yvonne pour all their energy into creating a home in the shape of a sand dune on the Coromandel Peninsula. (Final)

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Sophie Thomson gets a visit from a butterfly expert, Costa Georgiadis and Millie Ross travels to west Arnhem land, Josh Byrne dives into a seagrass revegetation project and Jerry Coleby-Williams talks Cats claw creepers.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: The Piano UK
programme.desc: Its the final concert at The Royal Festival. Can Claudia, Mika and Lang Lang get our four amateur pianists ready for the biggest performance of their lives?

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: When a prestigious chess match ends in murder, the team must work out how and why the killing was carried out. Meanwhile, the commissioner is confronted with his past by the very last person he was expecting to see. (Final)

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Rita and James have just 230 thousand dollars to self-build a sustainable, off-grid family home for themselves and their two kids. They plan to use recycled plastic bags, milk cartons, home-made bricks, and an earthen floor.

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: New Zealander Mark Ahearn and his Australian wife Liz are taking time out from their hectic lives in Perth to build a family holiday home in Abel Tasman. However their plans soon begin to systematically unravel.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Jerry Coleby-Williams visits a bushland botanic gardens, Millie Ross looks at climbing plants, Tino Carnevale shares tool tips, Josh Byrne explores an inspiring revegetation project and we meet a passionate frog expert.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: The Forsytes
programme.desc: Jolyon recommits to his family and June and Phil get engaged. Soames and Irenes Parisian honeymoon is cut short when Soames feels out of his depth.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Rita and James have just 230 thousand dollars to self-build a sustainable, off-grid family home for themselves and their two kids. They plan to use recycled plastic bags, milk cartons, home-made bricks, and an earthen floor.

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: Tragedy strikes in Saint-Fiacre, while back in Paris Maigrets absence has terrifying consequences. (Final)

programme.title: Spicks And Specks
programme.desc: Colin Lane gets on a roll, Danielle Walker shares her ride-on mower tips, Devaura needs her support teddy, and Kram is well... Kram. Somewhere amongst this, a quiz show happens ending with a performance by Grace Cummings.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Minecraft Challenge, Disney Dreamlight Valley And More
programme.desc: Its GGSP ICYMI, featuring some of the best GGSP clips from the last few years. This time its a Minecraft building challenge, a review of Disney Dreamlight Valley, and some of the best fake videogame sports ever invented.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Fishy Fundraiser
programme.desc: Amelia resents her fundraising cupcake stall being upstaged by a lemonade stall, so when things go sour, Amelia is accused of sabotage.

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: When Darrell is accused of smashing Mary-Lous precious pen, she and Sally must prove her innocence before she will be asked to leave Malory Towers forever.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: A dainty princess comes to Townsville.

programme.title: ABC Family Programs Resume At 7.30pm
programme.desc: ABC Family programs resume at 7:30pm.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun and the Flock discover that the Farmer has grand plans for their barn - that dont include them! Drastic action is needed if life on the farm is ever going to be the same again!

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The doctors are talking cancer and answering all the big questions: What is it? Why do people get it? How can it be treated? And how can you help someone going through it?

programme.title: Secret Life Of The Kangaroo
programme.desc: This three part series features one species of kangaroo, the Eastern Greys, which populate the woodland, pasture and forests of the Eastern side of Australia.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Pokemon Arceus, Splatoon, Flight Simulator And More
programme.desc: Its GGSP ICYMI, this time including a review of Pokemon Legends Arceus, Splatoon 3, and a crazy joyride in Microsoft Flight Simulator.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Distressed Dancer
programme.desc: When his dance troupes concert routine is sabotaged, Zac hires the Inbestigators to find out who at the dance academy is responsible.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.desc: The gang help Ricky Gervais with a haunted statue.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: Someone steals all the water in Townsville.

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Flock and the Pigs are playing a high-spirited game of rounders. Shaun steps up to the plate - will he score the winning run? Will the Pigs foul-play prevent victory? Or will the Farmer discover what theyre up to?

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Kai faces off against his former friend.

programme.title: Officially Amazing
programme.desc: Tyre juggling, hoop jumping, sandwich-making with the toes, and the highest bungee jump into water are just some of the records attempted today.

programme.title: Documentary Now!
programme.desc: An impressionistic look at the turbulent life of American Jazz guitarist Rex Logan, who became a cultural icon in Eastern Europe.

programme.title: Adam Hills: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Actor David Tennant and comedian Thanyia Moore join Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker to tear apart the weeks biggest news stories with savage wit and wisdom.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: The girls must replace the Professors Christmas present on Christmas Eve.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: When Marinettes class makes a short horror film, the lead actress is akumatized into a slimy monster that feeds off fear.

programme.title: 100% Wolf: The Book Of Hath
programme.desc: Werewolf Hunters invade Howlington and inadvertently discover a mysterious portal in the catacombs. Is this where all the strange creatures are coming from? And where are the twins?

programme.title: Total Drama Island
programme.desc: Catapult your team member into distant scoring zones to earn points but if you miss youll be landing in a penalty zone filled with all kind of evil. The first team to reach 10,000 points wins.

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: When the Bears realize whatever they build with snow comes to life they decide to build the biggest snow party of all time.

programme.title: Steven Universe
programme.desc: Steven looks like a hero when he forms a magic crystal bubble around himself to protect a girl he likes from danger, but then panics when he cant figure out how to turn the bubble off!

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: Can a small, disposable lighter suddenly ignite with the force of several sticks of dynamite? And, the MythBusters put on their boots, chaps and cowboy hats to try and shoot down some popular Gunslinger myths.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent Specials
programme.desc: Phil is in Billericay in Essex with a family struggling to keep up with the demands of their property. And over in Southend-on-Sea, Phil comes to the aid of serial mover and octogenarian, June. (Final)

programme.title: My Family
programme.sub-title: Hes Just Not That Into Ben
programme.desc: To prove how trendy and open-minded he is, Ben accompanies an embarrassed Michael to a gay club, where he gets chatted up by the adoring Rupert, who follows him home and sends him flowers.

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Collection
programme.desc: Saffy, Edinas daughter and Patsys nemesis, is next for the star treatment. Rivals for Edinas attention, she and Patsy never get on, unless theres an ulterior motive.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: The Titans trick Starfire into believing in second Christmas.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Santa Claus forces Beast Boy to become a spy and report on the Titans naughty behavior.

programme.title: Moominvalley
programme.desc: Snork Maiden encourages Moomintroll to take her on a voyage where Moominpappa once encountered the storm-chasing Hattifatteners.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: The agents try to resolve a disagreement between Ms O and Oksana.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: Fed up with sharing, Panda forbids his brothers from using his cellphone any longer. But when the brothers get their own super advanced smartphones, Panda starts to succumb to crippling jealousy.

programme.title: My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic
programme.desc: Spike accidentally invites Ember and Thorax to Ponyville on the same day! Hes sure the two new leaders are not going to get along so he does all he can to keep them apart and cover the fact that the other is there.

programme.title: Steven Universe
programme.desc: Steven joins an underground wrestling league with Amethyst, who is tired of Pearl and Garnet bringing her down.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: Adam and Jamie investigate; can Christmas lights cause a Christmas tree fire? Meanwhile, Kari, Grant and Tori investigate a frontier technology that if confirmed would take-off in a big way.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Purple-loving Pauline Ridley has been struggling to sell her terrace for six months. Phil soon discovers, this isnt just about Paulines penchant for deep purples and pinks, theres an asbestos scare in the mix too.

programme.title: Fracture
programme.desc: In this taut courtroom thriller, a young assistant district attorney gets involved in a deadly cat-and-mouse game with a man who tried to murder his wife. The young prosecutor refuses to give up.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: The Jedi put their flying skills to the test.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: King Thistle wants fish for dinner, so he goes out fishing with Mr Elf, Ben and Holly on Mr Elfs boat. Mr Elf tells them a story about the biggest, baddest fish ever - Big Bad Barry. The King wants to catch Barry for supper.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos are beside a river. They watch a fisherman cast out his line and then settle down for a nap. Chickedy and Chick run along the rod to the very end. Toodloo joins Chickedy and Chick.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Daniel cant wait to show Margaret all of the things they can do to celebrate Thank You Day at the Enchanted Garden!

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Sula, Pando and Bing find a birds nest in their playhouse, but learn they cant both be in it at the same time. Bing decides to give it to the bird... for now.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Pedro Pony spends the day just like a real cowboy would have in the Wild West: setting up camp in the garden and sharing stories with his friends.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Paddington decides to make a scrapbook of memories and tries to include all his friends to show Aunt Lucy.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Granny Thistle comes to visit and gives Daisy and Poppy a powerful magical wand. The children escape from the castle and...go bananas!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Today the new baby seat has arrived, but the family car has no room for it! With help from Peppa and George, Daddy Pig chooses a bigger car for the family.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: When Reef and Roadie are rejected from the cadets safety film, they disrupt the production with a set of pranks, but end up learning a valuable lesson about pretending to be in trouble when youre not.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: When a pack of pesky migrating trilobites overrun the ship Big Lizard has to use a hidden talent to lure them away. But one little trilobite, Rex, decides to stay.

programme.title: Play School: Whats Cooking?
programme.desc: Time for dinner! Alex and Kaeng get a lesson in making roly poly rice paper rolls and yummy dipping sauce from legendary cook Nagi Maehashi. Alex, Kaeng and Nagi are joined by Nagis best mate, Dozer, for a picnic dinner.

programme.title: Mixmups
programme.desc: The Mixmups visit a zoo to see if they can see a real tiger. The Zoo Keeper Lucky Loover Bird takes them on safari but the tigers wont come out of hiding. Can the Mixmups find another way to entice them out?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing finds a frog in the garden and wants to keep it so he and Sula make the frog a house in a bucket. But froggy doesnt like her new home and hops out.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: When Dads accused of fluffing in Blueys face as he climbed out of bed, hes put on trial with Mum as the judge and Bluey and Bingo as witnesses. But what was Bluey doing there?

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: In South Africa we find out whether Mister Maker can make some colourful creepy crawlies. In the UK, discover how to make an incredible igloo, and in the Far East a Mini Maker helps create an eye-catching ribbon picture.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: On a windy day, the team has to band together to get an important delivery done. When it seems like the elements will be too much, they find they can ask each other for help and get hard work done if they all work together.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its almost lunchtime at Peppa Pigs house. Mummy suggest they all make pizza together, they have a lot of fun preparing and mixing up all the food to make their own pizzas - its all so lovely and messy.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Fossilised honeysuckle is extremely yummy and extremely difficult to crack open. Ginger and the baby Pea-rexes must use all their clever thinking to open their prized meal.

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: Vida and Popcorns search for a mysterious stink in the Koala home leads to Pippens bad breath.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Decorator Crab
programme.desc: When important objects go missing from their ship, the Octonauts stake out the thief who turns out to be a decorator crab, stealing their things to decorate his shell.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: The PJ Masks think Luna and Motsuki are causing moon trouble, but its actually Pharaoh Boy.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When James plans a cafe makeover for the Wholefish Cafe, he becomes over-zealous which leads to a series of events that cause a fire.

programme.title: Play School: My Place My Home
programme.desc: Teo is exploring Alice Springs where he meets a thorny devil, a perentie, and a woma python. Hunter and Abi make different animal tracks in the sand, and Scrap and Slush log on to their computers to attend school online!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George go behind the scenes to find out how TV is made. Miss Rabbit shows them around the set of Super Potato.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Cosima and Big Lizard are helping Dad train for his astronaut fitness test. When Rex gets in to trouble Dads hard work finally pays off.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Gemmas obsession with a pair of passing whales distracts her from her duties. Meanwhile, one of the whales does some wombat watching and becomes beached.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: The PJs offer to help Motsuki find Luna but they dont listen to the stressed out little moth, so they miss a plot by Night Ninja right under their noses.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee has a pot of bubble mixture, and hes blowing fantastic bubbles. Its really hard to do but most of the squirrels eventually get the hang of it, and the club rapidly fills up with lots of bubbles. Pop, pop, pop!

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: The veggies are showing off their superhero sidekick costumes in a contest that Supertato is judging.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Kai and friends defend the forest creatures homes.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: King Thistle does not want to get any older so decides that no one must celebrate his birthday. But all of the Little Kingdom has been waiting to celebrate the Kings birthday with a brilliant party.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos watch people using a lift in a building. Chickedy and Chick follow two people into the lift and go up high with them, waving to Great BigHoo and Toodloo.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Prince Wednesday and Jodi learn how to take care of Prince Wednesdays new pet guinea pig when she needs to rest.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Grandpa Pig brings some seeds for Peppa and George to grow a garden. Daddy Pig makes himself useful by being the scarecrow.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Paddington discovers Mr Brown is a fantastic dancer so enters him into the Town Hall Talent Contest. However, Mr Brown gets stage fright. Paddington to the rescue!

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Mr Elf is overworked so King Thistle sentences him to a holiday. He isnt too pleased. Mrs Elf and Ben however are overjoyed at the news. Meanwhile Nanny takes over the food deliveries.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are at a Jigsaw festival with Granny and Grandpa Pig. Old Mrs Donkey explains how important it is not to lose a jigsaw piece but then Peppa spots one on the floor! Thankfully, Peppa finds its home.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Its the hottest day of summer and while Gemma leads a dolphin rescue, Pounce is determined to prove kangaroos can beat the heat.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Searching for a vital part of the ship lost during their crash landing, Cosima and Big Lizard find Dunk stuck on a beach. They use science to save the day and make a new friend.

programme.title: Play School: Whats Cooking?
programme.desc: You cant forget about dessert! Abi and Rachael are looking for a dreamy dessert to end the day. With help from dessert star Morgan Hipworth, they create a feast of watermelon pizza and banana and cauliflower ice cream

programme.title: Mixmups
programme.desc: When Spins pet ant dies, he takes to his duvet cave of sadness. Will Pockets and Giggle find "another way" to help Spin with his sadness?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing wants to play his car park game with Flop but Charlie is visiting and keeps messing up the game. Bing doesnt enjoy his game on his own and finds out that some games are better played together.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey and Bingo love to videochat with Muffin and Socks so they can all draw pictures together. When Muffin wont give Socks a turn, the kids discover what happens when you hog.

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: In Hong Kong Mini Makers help Mister Maker create a Chinese dragon picture. In South Africa, we discover whether he can make a super Silly Straw and in the UK, we go down to a farm and make a fabulous finger tip work of art.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: Thomas and Nia play with spare lights, excited to stay up all night to test them. James thinks that goofing is a waste of time and he is much to busy to stop his work for his own scheduled headlight repair.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Granny Pig, Peppa and George have fun dressing up as Romans, making a pebble mosaic of a Dinosaur and learn a little Latin too!

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: When Ginger gets stung by an Appleflyus it leaves a painful and incredibly itchy sore but, the only way to cure it is with the tail of an Appleflyus!

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: When Fergie is feeling off, Vida diagnoses her - shes having a sad day.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Kelp Forest Rescue
programme.desc: When Pesos little brother Pinto comes to visit, hes more interested in being a pirate than a medic - at least until he accompanies Peso on a mission to rescue Dashi and Shellington in a kelp forest.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: When Night Ninja needs the PJs help, our heroes cant help taking advantage of it.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: On a wildlife sketching trip, Norman wants to find the most spectacular creature to sketch, but this gets a bit tricky when Lily Chen tags along.

programme.title: Play School: My Place My Home
programme.desc: Teo is in Swan Valley with Little Ted, making friends with kangaroos and wombats! Miah and Nicholas go camping and whip up some delicious Johnny Cakes, and the toys work together to fix the Town Hall for its reopening

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are birdwatching with Grandpa Pig looking for birds and ticking them off in Grandpa pigs book.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: When the buggy gets a flat tyre Dad, Cosima and Big Lizard are stranded. Big Lizards playful nature helps reveal a creative solution to their problem.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets train Bondi and Sandy for their annual Iron Roo carnival - but how far are they willing to go to win?

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: When the Ninjalinos suddenly lose their ninja powers, the PJ Masks try to teach them alternative skills. But it seems impossible to get the Ninjalinos interested... Or is it?

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Its a day out; Duggee and the squirrels are off on an underwater adventure with Bettys dad in his submarine. They see all the wonders of the underwater world, including a giant sea stallion and some jazz fish.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Carrot has created the ultimate Superhero vehicle - The Tato Car. But, Evil Pea steals the car, not realising the Grape Kids are in the back seat!

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: Charles Webster, a man with a passion for technical engineering challenges, along with his wife Yvonne pour all their energy into creating a home in the shape of a sand dune on the Coromandel Peninsula. (Final)

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Know the latest on the days top stories, as Michael Tetlow brings you a comprehensive roundup of the news of the day. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow in Perth.

programme.title: Creative Types With Virginia Trioli
programme.desc: Patricia Piccinini, the artist who creates strange creatures from the frontiers of science and technology, tells us of the future that is already here and why she is compelled to "create the worlds" that live in her mind.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: Play On
programme.desc: Paul Kennedy visits The Bachar Houli Foundation which helps young Muslim Australians. Plus after a number drownings among the Indian migrant community, Dr Harpreet Kandra Singh set up swimming classes. (Final)

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the days top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to tell you whats happening and why it matters. Ros Childs brings you the latest news and information.

programme.title: ABC News With Joe OBrien
programme.desc: Joe OBrien brings you a comprehensive summary of the days events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on whats going on.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: The latest breaking news and a comprehensive roundup of the days best stories from across Australias states and regions. With reporters in more places ABC News tells the stories that matter to you. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Girish Sawlani presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: The Pacific: Summer Special
programme.desc: In this Summer Special of The Pacific: we investigate the scale of illegal fishing across the region and the toll its taking on Pacific nations. Plus we explore how growing militarisation in Palau is reshaping daily life.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: The Breakfast Couch
programme.desc: Bridget, James, Catherine, Nate and Steph Ferrier hear from Paul Mescal and Josh OConnor about their film The History of Sound plus Zak Hepburn, Casey Donovan and Chocolate Queen Kirsten Tibballs with a seasonal showstopper.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business show brings you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, investors, employees and business big and small. Presented by Alicia Barry. (Final for 2025)

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Girish Sawlani presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: News Breakfast
programme.desc: As the day begins get the facts you need to stay informed. James Glenday and Emma Rebellato bring you the latest news, overnight developments and todays top stories, plus Charles Brice with sport and Nate Byrne with weather.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Lorna Dunkley brings you todays top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter most.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to tell you whats happening and why it matters. Lorna Dunkley brings you the latest news and information.

programme.title: ABC News With Joe OBrien
programme.desc: Melissa Mackay brings you a comprehensive summary of the days events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on whats going on.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Melissa Mackay.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: The latest breaking news and a comprehensive roundup of todays best stories from across Australias states and regions. With reporters in more places ABC News tells the stories that matter to you. Presented by Manny Tsigas.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Manny Tsigas presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: The home of breaking news and in-depth coverage of the big stories from across Australia and around the globe. The ABCs network of reporters cover important stories and all the news you need. Presented by Manny Tsigas.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News. Weve got more reporters in more places, connecting communities and covering the stories and issues that matter to you. Presented by Craig Smart.
